meanings.definition: Misrelates: to tell or narrate incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: She misrelates the story every time she tells it.
meanings.sent2: He often misrelates the details of what happened.
meanings.sent3: The way he misrelates the plot of the movie always makes us laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her memory misrelates the events like a broken mirror reflecting a distorted image.
meanings.sent5: The child's imagination misrelates reality into a colorful tale.

meanings.definition: Misrelates: to have a mistaken or false understanding of a situation or event.
meanings.sent1: They misrelate the facts and draw the wrong conclusions.
meanings.sent2: She misrelates the intentions behind his actions.
meanings.sent3: His belief that cats can talk misrelates the truth in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Their fear misrelates the harmless shadow into a lurking monster.
meanings.sent5: The fog of confusion misrelates their perception of reality.
